episode: I am feeling a lot of anxiety due to changes at work and in my workload there.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I'm having a lot of anxiety right now due to changes at work that have nearly doubled my workload.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That sounds really overwhelming. How are you managing with all the extra work?

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I still haven't figured it out to be honest.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: I totally get that. Maybe try breaking it into smaller tasks?

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I'm a high performer and overall I'm well liked and respected at work, and I know the thought is that I can duplicate my prior success, but leadership isn't thinking about how much time that success actually took.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: It’s tough when they don’t see the time investment. Maybe you can discuss this with them?

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I've tried.  They've aligned a more junior person to me BUT they haven't reduced his workload to give him the time to help me out.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That's frustrating. Can you prioritize tasks to manage better?

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: The problem is that we aren't talking incremental time; it's literally impossible for me to do all of this well.  And leadership refuses to help me prioritize because they consider everything important.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That's really tough. Maybe you can document your concerns?

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I'm actually thinking about resigning.  I actually decided to come out of an early (and short) retirement two years ago to take this job because I wasn't ready to retire, but I don't need this level of stress in my life.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Taking care of yourself is key. Retirement seems like a good option.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: It would be an easier decision if the stock market hadn't taken such a hit lately!

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: I hear you, it complicates things. Have you considered consulting a financial advisor?

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: My finances are actually pretty well in order.  I didn't get hit as hard as I could have.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That's a relief! Maybe just take some time to weigh your options.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I definitely don't want to be reactionary.  In truth, if I told my manager that the workload was unreasonable and I was considering resigning because I can't meet their expectations, it may make them back off and reduce my workload.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: It's a bold move, but it might work. Worth trying!

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I have it in my back pocket, but I am going to make 100% sure there's no way for me to meet the minimum obligations of all the projects I now have.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That sounds wise. Good luck!
